title: Maintain Hygiene in Cold Weather
brief: Essential hygiene practices to prevent skin problems and infections in cold environments.
steps: Step 1: Take snow baths when washing is impractical - use a handful of snow to wash areas where sweat accumulates (under arms, between legs), then wipe dry immediately.
Step 2: Wash your feet daily if possible and put on clean, dry socks.
Step 3: Change underwear at least twice a week.
Step 4: If unable to wash underwear, remove it, shake it out, and let it air for 1-2 hours.
Step 5: Check your body and clothing for lice each night if using a previously occupied shelter.
Step 6: If you shave, do so before bed to allow skin recovery time before exposure.
warnings: Neglecting hygiene can lead to skin rashes that develop into serious medical problems.
If clothing becomes lice-infested and you have no insecticide, hang clothes in cold air, then beat and brush them - this removes lice but not eggs.
